Author: Alright#0419
Content: each of those sites can be profitable if you have a decent strategy or just plan to spec mine something

Author: Alright#0419
Content: but if you're just blindly renting hash, you're going to lose money

Author: Alright#0419
Content: recommend using MRR over the other two, nicehash has high diff requirements, meaning you're wasting hashrate if you're mining a (relatively)low diff coin and I haven't used hashtap at all

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
everyone  **ATTN: Pool Operators!** If you are operator or owner of these following pools, please make sure you are running latest Komodo daemon 0.4.0a for KMD and any other assetchains. If you have already updated your pool please let me know, so I can remove your pool from the non-updated list. **REMEMBER: KMD hardupdate is on 15th July which is just about a day and half away.** If you don't update your pool, you will be just wasting your hash. If you need help, please feel free to ask in this channel. Experienced pool operators are here to help you. For the operators that completed this update, please ignore this message. Thank you all.
```
http://mining4.co.uk/
https://aikapool.com/kmd/
https://kmd.saturnpool.com/
https://aikapool.com
https://pool.whibbit.cn/
https://kmd.basementpool.org/
https://kmd.miningfool.com/
https://kmd.suprnova.cc/
https://acpool.me/
https://fastblocks.net/
https://kmd.solopool.org/
```

```

2.2M    komodostate.ind
67M     notarisations
644K    peers.dat
4.0K    realtime
280K    signedmasks
112K    wallet.dat
```

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
the `nodl` could be mining which could explain the diff.

on a non-mining node i get:
```
.komodo du -sh blocks 
12G    blocks
```
on a kmd miner node: 
```
~/.komodo/blocks$ du -sh
18G    .
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: also depends on which indexes are enabled

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: KMD and all assetchains has 0.00010000 default txfee

Author: Alright#0419
Content: can send 0 tx fee txes just fine almost always though

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you pay tx fees in the chain you're using

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so if an asset has their own chain, you tx fees in that asset

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
BTC has nothing to do with the average user of Komodo @Stratchlayer 
The only BTC involved is for Notary Nodes to notarise the chain onto the BTC chain.
